definitions.definition: The return of a difficult ball
The recovery of game once sprung.
To regain or get back something.
definitions.example: to retrieve one's character or independence; to retrieve a thrown ball

definitions.definition: To fetch or carry back something.
To fetch and bring in game.
definitions.example: The cook doesn't care what's shot, only what's actually retrieved.

definitions.definition: To fetch and bring in game systematically.
definitions.example: Dog breeds called 'retrievers' were selected for retrieving.

definitions.definition: To fetch or carry back systematically, notably as a game.
definitions.example: Most dogs love retrieving, regardless of what object is thrown.

definitions.definition: To make a difficult but successful return of the ball.
To remedy the evil consequence of, to repair (a loss or damage).
